text: Before you're a mom you don't know what gear is going to be relevant.
author: Emily Procter

text: My mom and my dad were married 56 years, and the fact that I reconciled with my dad I think made their marriage a little bit better as well.
author: Larry Elder

text: I was embarrassed that I even wanted to become an actress because coming from L.A., with two older sisters in the business and a mom who had been a ballet dancer, it was such a cliche.
author: Elizabeth Olsen

text: From the very start of all of this, my mom has read the scripts first. And if she liked something, she let me read it. She told our agent what kinds of parts that we would want.
author: Anna Chlumsky

text: I had no idea of the size of my bank account as a teen, and I didn't care to know. That was my mom's job, I figured that I would just find out when I turned 18. If you can't trust your mom, then who can you trust?
author: Anna Chlumsky
